Anyhow, occurs to me that if your system is using inetd/xinetd you may not have some default entry for lpd on port 631. also the port may be still commented out in the /etc/services section
Check your cgi-common area then. I think it's usually somewhere like /usrshare/cgi-bin
It must have some embedded webserver otherwise it wouldn't run.
Well, regardless of what server is underneath then, the executables for it will be in the cgi common dirs
Might be permissions are screwy there for it to run or so

Since multiple webservers use the common cgi-bin dir, and web applications which use executables normally look there for these things. Also in this directory structure there is usually found application-specific directories containing perl or php scripts etc which are for specific control programs.
